events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle on highway 55, requesting to file a claim for damages.
The claim was classified under Auto Accident based on the keywords vehicle collision and car accident described by the customer.
An insurance agent specializing in auto accidents was assigned to handle the claim and contact the customer for more details.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the process would begin promptly.
The agent requested accident photos, police report, and vehicle registration documents to support the investigation.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including the police report, car damage photos, and registration proof.
The investigation team began reviewing all submitted materials and contacted witnesses to verify the incident details.
The investigation concluded the claim is valid, confirming that the accident was due to another driver's negligence.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover damage repair costs and medical bills associated with the accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the claim handling process and the proposed settlement amount.
The claim was officially approved, authorizing the payment to be issued to cover the repair and other costs.
The insurance company transferred the approved settlement amount to the customer's bank account.
The claim was closed following confirmation of payment receipt and customer acknowledgment of claim resolution.
All documents and investigation files related to the auto accident claim have been archived in the system.
